text: <a href="../1-Corinthians-11-1/" title="1 Corinthians 11:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Be ye followers of me, even as I also *am* of Christ.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-2/" title="1 Corinthians 11:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 Now I praise you, brethren, that ye remember me in all things, and keep the ordinances, as I delivered *them* to you.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-3/" title="1 Corinthians 11:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 But I would have you know, that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the woman *is* the man; and the head of Christ *is* God.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-4/" title="1 Corinthians 11:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 Every man praying or prophesying, having *his* head covered, dishonoureth his head.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-5/" title="1 Corinthians 11:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 But every woman that prayeth or prophesieth with *her* head uncovered dishonoureth her head: for that is even all one as if she were shaven.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-6/" title="1 Corinthians 11:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 For if the woman be not covered, let her also be shorn: but if it be a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven, let her be covered.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-7/" title="1 Corinthians 11:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 For a man indeed ought not to cover *his* head, forasmuch as he is the image and glory of God: but the woman is the glory of the man.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-8/" title="1 Corinthians 11:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 For the man is not of the woman; but the woman of the man.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-9/" title="1 Corinthians 11:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 Neither was the man created for the woman; but the woman for the man.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-10/" title="1 Corinthians 11:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 For this cause ought the woman to have power on *her* head because of the angels.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-11/" title="1 Corinthians 11:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Nevertheless neither is the man without the woman, neither the woman without the man, in the Lord.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-12/" title="1 Corinthians 11:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 For as the woman *is* of the man, even so *is* the man also by the woman; but all things of God.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-13/" title="1 Corinthians 11:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman pray unto God uncovered?

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-14/" title="1 Corinthians 11:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 Doth not even nature itself teach you, that, if a man have long hair, it is a shame unto him?

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-15/" title="1 Corinthians 11:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 But if a woman have long hair, it is a glory to her: for *her* hair is given her for a covering.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-16/" title="1 Corinthians 11:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 But if any man seem to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither the churches of God.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-17/" title="1 Corinthians 11:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 Now in this that I declare *unto you* I praise *you* not, that ye come together not for the better, but for the worse.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-18/" title="1 Corinthians 11:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 For first of all, when ye come together in the church, I hear that there be divisions among you; and I partly believe it.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-19/" title="1 Corinthians 11:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 For there must be also heresies among you, that they which are approved may be made manifest among you.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-20/" title="1 Corinthians 11:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 When ye come together therefore into one place, *this* is not to eat the Lord's supper.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-21/" title="1 Corinthians 11:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 For in eating every one taketh before *other* his own supper: and one is hungry, and another is drunken.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-22/" title="1 Corinthians 11:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 What? have ye not houses to eat and to drink in? or despise ye the church of God, and shame them that have not? What shall I say to you? shall I praise you in this? I praise *you* not.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-23/" title="1 Corinthians 11:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you, That the Lord Jesus the *same* night in which he was betrayed took bread:

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-24/" title="1 Corinthians 11:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 And when he had given thanks, he brake *it*, and said, Take, eat: this is my body, which is broken for you: this do in remembrance of me.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-25/" title="1 Corinthians 11:25 KJV verse detail"><span id="27" class="versehover">25 After the same manner also *he took* the cup, when he had supped, saying, This cup is the new testament in my blood: this do ye, as oft as ye drink *it*, in remembrance of me.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-26/" title="1 Corinthians 11:26 KJV verse detail"><span id="28" class="versehover">26 For as often as ye eat this bread, and drink this cup, ye do shew the Lord's death till he come.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-27/" title="1 Corinthians 11:27 KJV verse detail"><span id="29" class="versehover">27 Wherefore whosoever shall eat this bread, and drink *this* cup of the Lord, unworthily, shall be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-28/" title="1 Corinthians 11:28 KJV verse detail"><span id="30" class="versehover">28 But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of *that* bread, and drink of *that* cup.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-29/" title="1 Corinthians 11:29 KJV verse detail"><span id="31" class="versehover">29 For he that eateth and drinketh unworthily, eateth and drinketh damnation to himself, not discerning the Lord's body.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-30/" title="1 Corinthians 11:30 KJV verse detail"><span id="32" class="versehover">30 For this cause many *are* weak and sickly among you, and many sleep.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-31/" title="1 Corinthians 11:31 KJV verse detail"><span id="33" class="versehover">31 For if we would judge ourselves, we should not be judged.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-32/" title="1 Corinthians 11:32 KJV verse detail"><span id="34" class="versehover">32 But when we are judged, we are chastened of the Lord, that we should not be condemned with the world.
<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-33/" title="1 Corinthians 11:33 KJV verse detail"><span id="35" class="versehover">33 Wherefore, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, tarry one for another.

<a href="../1-Corinthians-11-34/" title="1 Corinthians 11:34 KJV verse detail"><span id="36" class="versehover">34 And if any man hunger, let him eat at home; that ye come not together unto condemnation. And the rest will I set in order when I come.
